msContents.summary: The document is called “written security” (ἔγγραφοϲ ἀϲφάλεια), a term which does not determine its nature. It must in one way or another have concerned ecclesiastical property. The person who drew up the contract was a deacon or archdeacon of the Petra church, who can be none other than Theodoros, son of Obodianos. The addressee was probably Theodoros’ uncle and father-in-law Patrophilos.

msItemStruct.note: Written transversa charta. The original width may well have been the usual 26–29 cm and the distance between lines was 1.2–1.7 cm. Top margin at least 7 cm right margin 1.5–3 cm. The large upright hand suggests a professional scribe.
